issue.title: [CF 681] Allow buff vs debuff comparisons
issue.body:
Current functionality allows for the comparisons between buff vs buff, or debuff vs debuff. Feral spec could really use the ability to compare duration of Rip (a debuff on the target) vs Savage Roar (a buff on the player) for desynchronization.


> Posted by CurseForge user solitha | Imported from CurseForge issue #681 | Raw

comments.body:
There is no way that this could possibly fit into the condition editor right now without drastically re-arranging everything. Such functionality is best left to a Lua condition.

Use something like this:

``` AuraDur("target", "rip", "rip", "HARMFUL PLAYER") > AuraDur("player", "savage roar", "savage roar", "HELPFUL") ```

Let me know if you need any more help with this.

Edited Nov 4, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Hi, thanks for the reply.

The recommended desync between those two is by 4 seconds... ie, if there's 4s or less difference between the two durations, refresh one to knock them out of synch.

RIght now all I have a clock-faced icon to nudge me to look at the durations on those two, but it's not really an efficient way to handle it as my mental math abilities are sucky and slow.


> Posted by CurseForge user solitha

This should do the trick:

``` abs(AuraDur("target", "rip", "rip", "HARMFUL PLAYER") - AuraDur("player", "savage roar", "savage roar", "HELPFUL")) < 4 ```

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
